title: Johnny Conqueroo 'Brick' Single Release Show
brief_description: Johnny Conqueroo with Voodoo Economics (Louisville) and People Planet (Lexington)
description:
Johnny Conqueroo, "Brick" - Single Release Show !

ALL AGES, Al's Bar / Friday April 13th, $7/ $10

Celebrate the release of our new single/video for "Brick".

Our homies from Louisville ( Voodoo Economics) and Lexington (People Planet) are ready to pack Al's with a great night of music.

We'll have a buncha new tunes, and a sick new t-shirt - it's going to be a good one y'all.

11pm Johnny Conqueroo

10 pm Voodoo Economics (Louisville)

9pm People Planet

title: R.C. May Photography Lecture: Karen Irvine
brief_description: FREE lecture by the Chief Curator and Deputy Director of the Museum of Contemporary Photography at Columbia College Chicago
description:
FREE lecture by the Chief Curator and Deputy Director of the Museum of Contemporary Photography at Columbia College Chicago. Karen Irvine helps to lead one of the most vibrant centers for photography in the Midwest, while also working on projects internationally. She will speak on her approach to uncovering and supporting the work of emerging and mid-career photographers through a rigorous program of exhibitions, publications, special projects, and acquisitions.


Irvine has organized more than fifty exhibitions of contemporary photography at MoCP and other venues, among them the Lishui International Photography Festival, China; Daegu Photography Biennale, South Korea; and the New York Photo Festival. Her exhibitions include Petcoke: Tracing Dirty Energy; North Korean Perspectives; and Grace of Intention: Photography, Architecture, and the Monument. She is also a frequent writer on photography, contributing to numerous journals and books.

title: Agnosiophobia: The Fear of Not Knowing
brief_description: Five Transylvania University studio art majors present their thesis works in Morlan Gallery from April 9-16.
description:
Five Transylvania University studio art majors will present their thesis works in Morlan Gallery from April 9-16 in an exhibition titled “Agnosiophobia: The Fear of Not Knowing.”

The public is invited to brief art talks in the gallery by each senior about their works from 4-5 p.m. Friday, April 13. A reception will follow.

The graduating studio art majors are Jessica Chandler, from Louisville, Ky.; Claire Gardner, from Lexington; Annelisa Hermosilla, from Panama City, Panama; Samantha Klintworth, from Westerville, Ohio; and Poppy Liu, from Chengdu, China.

Morlan Gallery—which is on the main level of Transylvania's Mitchell Fine Arts Center—is open weekdays, noon to 5 p.m., and by special appointment. Free, nearby parking is available. For an appointment, call Morlan Gallery Director Andrea Fisher 24 hours prior to viewing at (859) 233-8142.

title: Sound + Color (a benefit for heARTplay and MusicWorks)
brief_description: Join us for an evening of music and fun to benefit heARTplay and MusicWorks!
description:
Join us for an evening of music and fun to benefit heARTplay and MusicWorks! Due to capacity requirements at ARTplay, this will be a ticketed event with limited tickets available. Instead of a set price for tickets, we are asking for a pay-what-you-can donation. Please note that each individual, all ages, will need to have a ticket for entry.

//

heARTplay is the scholarship program of ARTplay that provides opportunities for children in foster and kinship care to attend ARTplay classes at no cost. More info about ARTplay here: https://artplaykids.com/


MusicWorks is a free community youth orchestra rehearsing daily in Lexington's Northside. Modeled on Venezuela's revolutionary education movement, El Sistema, MusicWorks fosters positive youth development by providing equitable access to high quality music education. More info here: http://musicworksckyo.org/

//

Our musical guests for the evening:

*The Other Years (Louisville, KY)

*Julia Purcell (Louisville, KY)

*Anna Hess//Joanna James//Richard Young (Lexington, KY)

*MusicWorks student performance

//

Light refreshments will be available. Rolling Oven Pizza is just a stone's throw away, so feel free to grab some food & bring it back over.

//

Our friends at West Sixth Brewing will be serving up some of their yummy beers and Hartfield & Co. will be on site mixing up some delicious drinks in their horse trailer turned cocktail bar!

//

We appreciate your help in increasing opportunities for children to engage in the arts. After we cover costs for the evening, proceeds will be split 50/50 between heARTplay + MusicWorks. We will also have a silent art auction (kid-created pieces) with the proceeds going to the programs.

//

Feel free to donate on site or donations can be made online here as well: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sound-color-a-benefit-for-heartplay-musicworks-tickets-43884187787

title: 2018 SOfAH Symposium
venues: Bolivar Art Gallery - UK School of Art
brief_description: The UK Student Organization for Art History (SOfAH) presents its first interdisciplinary symposium, on the relationships between aesthetics and politics
description:
The UK Student Organization for Art History (SOfAH) presents its first interdisciplinary symposium, on the relationships between aesthetics and politics. 


In today’s sociopolitical climate — where protesters regularly take to the streets with visually striking signs that claim their right to representation and fight discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, religion, and nationality — the political potential of aesthetics demands attention. Furthermore, as powerful politicians deploy images on social media with the aim of manipulating their publics, the role of aesthetics in politics has become a vital issue to consider.

This symposium aims to address the question: What role does aesthetics, with its emphasis on nature, representation, and subjectivity, play in today’s political climate?


PRESENTERS:

Jonathan Wright, 'The Abstraction of ‘the Political’ in Aesthetic Discourse'

Kristen Hankins, 'How did the feminist movements of the 1960s-70s impact women’s advancement in the workplace?'

S.F. Means, 'The Black Power Aesthetic: Tracing Political Symbols from California to São Paulo'

Charlsa Hensley, 'Counter/Collective Memory on Monument Avenue'

Gabe Tomlin, 'The Darker Planets'


Light refreshments will be provided!

title: The Watermelon Woman
brief_description: Cheryl Dunye's debut feature is as controversial as it is sexy and funny
description:
There are no trailers, just clips online

Cheryl Dunye's debut feature is as controversial as it is sexy and funny. Cheryl is a twenty-something black lesbian working as a clerk in a video store while struggling to make a documentary about Fae Richards, an obscure black actress from the 1930's. Cheryl is surprised to discover that Richards (known popularly as 'the Watermelon Woman') had a white lesbian lover. At the same time, Cheryl falls in love with a very cute white customer at the video store (Guinevere Turner from GO FISH). Such are the complexities of race and sex in this startlingly fresh debut, which has been attacked by conservative Congressmen for having been funded by the NEA and lavishingly praised in the editorial pages for being charming and courageous.

title: Kentucky Writers on the Land Listening Party
brief_description: Join us in celebrating the writers featured in the exhibit ROOTED WORDS: KENTUCKY WRITERS ON THE LAND
description: Join us in celebrating the writers featured in the exhibit ROOTED WORDS: KENTUCKY WRITERS ON THE LAND, on view at the Community Gallery of the Pam Miller Downtown Arts Center in Lexington March 9- May 13. Readings by Bobbie Ann Mason, Erik Reece, Gray Zeitz, Jonathan Greene, Leatha Kendrick, Mark Schimmoeller, Maurice Manning, Mary Ann Taylor-Hall, Richard Taylor, and others. We'll listen to short clips of oral history interviews with Barbara Kingsolver, Nikky Finney, and Wendell Berry. Reception and exhibit viewing to follow at the Pam Miller Downtown Arts Center's Community Gallery, just across the street. Featuring food by Ouita Michel and music by Sam Gleaves. Free and open to the public.

title: An Inspired Evening honoring Ouita Michel
brief_description: We are honoring Ouita Michel, as inspiring chef, restaurant owner and force in the culinary community. Proceeds from An Inspired Evening support all of the ambitious exhibitions and public programs we present throughout the year.
description:
Join us for An Inspired Evening, the UK Art Museum’s new fundraising soiree and an unforgettable night of fabulous food and drink, special performances, and glee throughout the galleries! We are honoring Ouita Michel, as inspiring chef, restaurant owner and force in the culinary community. Proceeds from An Inspired Evening support all of the ambitious exhibitions and public programs we present throughout the year.


Enjoy small bites from Tyler McNabb (Holly Hill Inn),

Tanya Whitehouse (The Food Connection at UK),

Josh Smouse (Honeywood), Sorella Gelateria, and

DaRae and Friend’s Catering.

Music by Italian Beaches.

Event design by Maui Crane.

Entertainment by Sora Contemporary Circus.


Tickets: $75 each, available online: http://bit.ly/inspiredtickets.


Presented by VisitLEX.


For more information, contact Kate Sprengnether: ksprengnether@uky.edu or 859-257-6218.


Supported by:

Jim Albisetti; Creation Gardens; Dwell Kentucky; Miller Edwards Rambicure & Scott White; River City Distributing; Smiley Pete Publishing; The Summit at Fritz Farm; Trek Advancement; Uk Alumni Association; West 6th Brewing; and Woodford Reserve.

title: Daniel Ludwig: New Works 2016-2018
venues: Heike Pickett Gallery and Sculpture Garden
brief_description: Most recent paintings by Daniel Ludwig
description:
Exhibiting: April 21 - June 8

Daniel Ludwig: New Works is celebrating the artist's 35th year with the Gallery. Daniel Ludwig was featured in Heike Pickett Gallery's inaugural show in 1983. The Gallery in Versailles is featuring Ludwig's most recent work in conjunction with the Daniel Ludwig: Retrospective at Georgetown College.

Ludwig now shows in New York, London, and Berlin.


Heike Pickett Gallery and Sculpture Garden will be open Fridays and Saturdays during the exhibition from 11:00 am until 4:00 pm or by appointment

title: Daniel Ludwig Retrospective: 35 Years of Artworks in Kentucky Area Collections
venues: Anne Wright Wilson Gallery at Georgetown College
address: Corner of E. College Street and Mulberry Street
brief_description: Feature paintings, sculpture, and drawings by the artist from the past 35 years
description:
Exhibiting: April 22 - May 25

Daniel Ludwig Retrospective will feature painting, sculpture, and drawings by the artist from the past 35 years at the Anne Wright Wilson Gallery at Georgetown College. The works are predominately form Kentucky area Private Collections including Centre College, UK Art Museum, and the Jacobs' Collection at Georgetown College. Daniel Ludwig currently lives in New York and is represented by galleries in New York, London, and Berlin.


Anne Wright Wilson Gallery will be open Wednesdays through Saturdays during the exhibition from 12:00 pm until 4:30 pm or by appointment

title: OJS Presents: Chris Potter
brief_description: We're very excited to present one of the biggest living names in jazz, Chris Potter, live at the Lyric Theater
description:
"Easily the most compelling saxophonist of his generation."

- Detroit Free Press


We're very excited to present one of the biggest living names in jazz, Chris Potter, live at the Lyric Theater.


A world-class soloist, accomplished composer, and formidable bandleader, Grammy Award winning saxophonist Chris Potter has emerged as a leading light of his generation. Potter’s music showcases limitless creativity and a vibrant sense of swing, prompting critics, musicians, and fans alike to cite him as the one of the finest saxophonists today.


The New Yorker calls Potter, “A tenorist who can remind you of Joe Henderson at his craftiest, he employs his considerable technique in the service of music rather than spectacle.”


Throughout his career, Potter has performed and recorded with artists as diverse as Steely Dan and Herbie Hancock, and has toured the world over with the Dave Holland Quintet, the Overtone Quartet, AZIZA, and the jazz-funk group, Chris Potter’s Underground.


The Dreamer is the Dream, by the Chris Potter Quartet, is the current chapter in Potter’s storied career.

title: Opening Reception: deer in the headlights
brief_description: 'deer in the headlights' addresses fear responses, what causes them, and the thought processes and mental states that manifest from prolonged exposure to fear due to outside stressors
description:
a.e. stone’s solo exhibition "deer in the headlights" will be open from April, 27-29, 2018 with an Opening Reception on April 27, 2018 at 6pm.


"deer in the headlights" addresses fear responses, what causes them, and the thought processes and mental states that manifest from prolonged exposure to fear due to outside stressors.


presented in a series of screen prints, darkroom photographic prints, and books.

brief_description: You know this is the best place to dance to disco in the country right?
description: You know this is the best place to dance to disco in the country right? We will turn the lights off, turn the volume up, and forget the outside world and its troubles. We do hope that you’ll join us.

title: Leonard Cohen Tribute Encore
brief_description: Hallelujah: The Leonard Cohen Tribute is back by popular demand
description:
Hallelujah: The Leonard Cohen Tribute is back by popular demand at the Lyric Theatre on April 28. Tickets are on sale at the Lyric Theatre box office: www.lexingtonlyric.tix.com and 859-280-2218.


The sold-out November 2017 show featured 35 Central Kentucky artists coming together in 13 acts to bring their considerable talent and respect to Cohen’s incomparable catalog. Two new performers will join the original artists in the reprise: 17-year old multi-instrumentalist and soulful vocalist, Daisy Helmuth, and Paul K, a staple of the Lexington blues and folk scene in the 90’s.


Original artists include One Lane Bridge, Colin Fleming, Paper Moon Trio, Quantum Mechanics, Four Leonards (and a Fifth), The Sherry Sebastian Trio, The Partisans, Doc Feldman with Art Shechet, The Joanna James Trio, Nevi’im, and Lauren Hill, Lorne Dechtenberg and Diane Arnson Svarlien.


“A startling Leonard Cohen Tribute…If there was a single concert event that underscored a sense of community this year it was the November summit honoring the songs of Leonard Cohen. There were wonderfully unspoiled and inventive interpretations of Cohen’s often prophetically poetic works that culminated with the artists and the audience singing ‘Hallelujah’ together…A rich and stylistically far-reaching overview.” -- Walter Tunis / Lexington Herald Leader


“For six decades, Leonard Cohen revealed his soul to the world through poetry and song—his deep time and timeless humanity touching our very core. Simply brilliant. His music and words will resonate forever.” –Rock and Roll Hall of Fame, 2008

Co-produced by the online cultural affairs publication UnderMain and Purple Carrots Productions.


Get your tickets early. The first show sold out quickly!

title: W.M.R. Fest
brief_description: Watch Me Rise Fest is a 2 day celebration of overcoming all mental health with a positive outlet. A portion of the door money will go to the Mental Health America Association.
description:
Mental health does not shy away from the underground community. It does not effect you based off of your gender/ race/ color/ religious beliefs. It effects all of us as humans. Watch Me Rise Fest is a 2 day celebration of overcoming all mental health with a positive outlet. A portion of the door money will go to the Mental Health America Association. Come hang out and drown out something that effects us all. Thank you to our sponsor CD Central. Days and schedule will be announced closer to the date.

$10 suggested donation

Doors at 6:30

Music at 7:00 sharp!!

RESPECT THE SPACE!! Remember this is a art gallery!!

title: Lunafest Lexington
brief_description: 9th Annual Lunafest Lexington - an inspirational evening of short films by, for, and about women
description:
9th Annual Lunafest Lexington - an inspirational evening of short films by, for, and about women.


This year's film selections are sure to inspire! And your attendance will raise funds to support our services for survivors of intimate partner abuse.


Ticket sales begin March 15.


Invite a few friends for a wonderful evening out or purchase a couple of tickets for the perfect Mother's Day gift.


LUNAFEST, a traveling short film festival celebrating women

filmmakers, is brought to you by LUNABar.

title: Whiskey Bear Live with DJ David Austin
brief_description: We're excited to bring some of Lexington's favorite artists for the launch of Whiskey Bear Live
description:
We're excited to bring some of Lexington's favorite artists for the launch of Whiskey Bear Live. Join us every Saturday, grab dinner from one of your favorite local restaurants, enjoy a drink with us and settle in for an evening full of great live music.


David Austin is a local artist, musician and DJ. As part of Thank You for Coming to Our Parties, he's helped re-ignite Lexington's love of dancing with parties such as Higher.

title: The Handsome Family
brief_description: The Handsome Family’s greatest gift lies in its tremendous talent for painting vivid, sometimes terrifying pictures with every word— NPR
description:
The Handsome Family’s greatest gift lies in its tremendous talent for painting vivid, sometimes terrifying pictures with every word— NPR


The Handsome Family’s absorbing vision of decay and entropy is quietly unsettling and makes most other modern roots music seem like child’s play—MOTHER JONES


Words that in their everyday surrealism have no parallel in contemporary writing... Music that mines the deep veins of fatalism in the Appalachian voice — GREIL MARCUS


As songwriters it’s the eerie, ancestral voice of ‘Anonymous’ they ultimately resemble the most —CHICAGO READER


Through the Trees (1998)—10 essential Americana records of all time — MOJO

In the Air (2000) —One of the most important records of the 21st century — UNCUT 'Weightless Again'—100 best songs ever written about heartbreak— THE GUARDIAN, UK
